question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
For calculating this integral we use substitution.

\[\begin{aligned} \int_{-1}^0\frac{1}{\sqrt{1-x}}dx = \int_{-1}^0(1-x)^{-\frac12}dx.\end{aligned}\]

We define u=1-x, du=-dx. The new limits of the integral are u(-1)=1-(-1)=2 and u(0)=1-0=1. Hence

\[\begin{aligned} \int_2^1u^{-\frac12}(-du) = \int_1^2u^{-\frac12}du = \left[2u^{\frac12}\right]_1^2 = 2(\sqrt2-1).\end{aligned}\]
